speaker: Keeper & NPCs
lines: Griffin McElroy

speaker: Aubrey Little/Lady Flame
lines: Travis McElroy

speaker: Edmund “Ned” Chicane
lines: Clint McElroy

speaker: Duck Newton
lines: Justin McElroy

speaker: Beacon
lines: Justin McElroy

speaker: Griffin
lines: Previously, on the Adventure Zone…

speaker: Vincent
lines: You gotta forget this night ever happened. You walk through that gate and never come back.

speaker: Duck
lines: Right underneath, uh, preservation of forest, my number two skill is forgetting about weird shit. [Clint laughs] So you have come to the right department, here…

speaker: Dani
lines: We can’t really live without some… sustaining… life? force? You know the springs? Behind Amnesty Lodge? Those have enough juice, I think, for a lot of us to keep going.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, you can tell that this light that was in the water is now… just gone.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Good news is, I think we’re safe for the time being, ’cause whatever was in that pool seems to be gone.

speaker: Duck
lines: All right, mission accomplished.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Well…

speaker: Duck
lines: Good work Pine Guard, huh?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Then we’ve got the bad news.

speaker: Ned
lines: Which is?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: I think maybe it went into, you know, all the water? Like in town?

speaker: Duck
lines: Well… Fuck.

speaker: [Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Amnesty Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Y’all know Anthony Bourdain came to West Virginia? [Travis Yeah.] For an episode of his show Anthony Bourdain Taste the World?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, where did he go?

speaker: Travis
lines: Was he very— was he complimentary?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He was. You know he did all the stuff that we love. Um… eating— he probably, like, ate a rattlesnake at one point and was like, “Mm, now this is real country,” and y’know, probably played ping pong at a church or something like that, but I’m trying to figure out how to, like, [making a list] is he gonna show up in the middle of a monster hunt, or is he gonna—

speaker: Travis
lines: Ooh, okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: That would be like—

speaker: Travis
lines: Maybe he’s the monster!

speaker: Griffin
lines: [continuing list] Maybe he’s the monster…

speaker: Clint
lines: That would be, like, our third Bourdain reference in the whole series! That’d be very cool.

speaker: Travis
lines: That would free us from the podcast, y’know.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, okay. [Justin laughs] So, the three of you arrive back at Amnesty Lodge, and it’s nearing sunset, and as you enter the lobby, you realize it’s a bit emptier than usually? As you—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Huh, it’s a bit emptier than usual!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, and then Aubrey says that. And then you see Barclay through the kitchen window, he’s doing some dishes. Dani is sitting in a recliner by the front window, and she’s reading a Lamplighter. And both of them seem slightly on edge, and it only takes a few moments to figure out why, as Agent Stern enters the lobby from the doors leading out to the hot springs behind the lodge. And he’s wearing slippers, and a robe, and it’s— [Clint laughs] He looks so refreshed, and just happy as a clam, and he says,

speaker: Agent Stern
lines: Ned, Aubrey, Duck— I can’t thank you enough for helping me find this place! I didn’t really know what to expect during my stay here in Kepler, but these accommodations are fantastic! And I must have lucked out, too, because my room doesn’t appear to have any bedbugs at all.

speaker: Duck
lines: Well, they can be, uh… small. [pause] They’re real small… around these parts.

speaker: Agent Stern
lines: So you think they could— I guess I’ll do an extra sweep, thanks for the heads up. I didn’t know you grew bedbugs extra small here in Kepler.

speaker: Duck
lines: It’s for your convenience.

speaker: Agent Stern
lines: I actually just got out of the hot springs, where I had the most lovely conversation with a man named Jake Coolice? He is a delight!

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah, he’s all right.

speaker: Duck
lines: Coolice in the hot springs, huh? Love it. That’s a day, right there. Now that’s a day.

speaker: Agent Stern
lines: Yeah, it’s quite a name… Ned, uh, I was hoping to come by in the morning to see the full Bigfoot video, would that work for you?

speaker: Ned
lines: Ooh, I’m speaking to the Junior Chamber of Commerce at their breakfast meeting tomorrow… Maybe later in the day, perhaps?

speaker: Agent Stern
lines: Uh… I’ll find you, we’ll figure something out. You all have a—

speaker: Ned
lines: [laughing nervously] Sure!

speaker: Agent Stern
lines: You all have a great evening.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says, and he goes to retire to his room. And Barclay enters the lobby from the kitchen, and he’s drying his hands with a rag, and he says

speaker: Barclay
lines: Okay, so, how did the investigation go?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [nervous noise] Hold on!

speaker: Travis
lines: And Aubrey, like, makes sure that the agent is gone.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He’s gone.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Well, to answer that question, “Barkly”—

speaker: Barclay
lines: Barclay? How are you— you’ve been here a couple of months, it’s weird that you—

speaker: Travis
lines: No, that’s my nickname for Barkly. [crosstalk] Barclay, Barkly.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Oh, cute!

speaker: Travis
lines: ’Cause he’s… Ahh, I got nothing.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Barclay… Not great, honestly. [stammers]

speaker: Ned
lines: We won… right?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [high-pitched] Well…

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think, in the effort of making this not a, like, extended in-fiction repeat of what happened in the last episode, I thought it would be a good time to talk about what you all actually learned about the monster during the— about the abomination during your encounter with it.

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s Alex Mack, one.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s not that.

speaker: Travis
lines: It is Alex Mack! It’s a puddle—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] I mean, it’s a shapeshifting…

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] A living puddle?

speaker: Griffin
lines: …Yes.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s Alex Mack, dude.

speaker: Justin
lines: It has the ability to just like, self-replicate, I guess you could say? Or like, change its mass. But it does seem to be vulnerable to weapon attacks, right? Like we did seem to damage it with— by attacking it, right?

speaker: Travis
lines: This is the thing that I’m trying to figure out is the creature the water, or is the creature using the water?

speaker: Griffin
lines: There was the light in the water, that Aubrey, you could see, and Ned could see when he got very, very close to it. When viewed from outside, the light in the water is invisible, and seemed to only be controlling the water that it was connected to.

speaker: Travis
lines: So to Justin’s question, are we hurting it with weapons attacks, or are we just separating it from the water it’s controlling with weapon attacks?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think you lay all that out to Barclay, and he, especially when you mention the light, he kind of perks up, and he says

speaker: Barclay
lines: Okay, actually, I know what I said, but that kind of rings a bell. Let’s retire to the privacy of Mama’s office, I think I might have something.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he walks you into Mama’s office. And her office has changed in her absence. It’s much, much neater and more orderly than the last time you were in here. The maps and books that were once scattered all around the table and her desk have been organized into neat piles, there’s no dishes laying all about. You get the distinct impression that Barclay has been wanting to clean this room for a very long time, and finally got the opportunity to do so. And he walks over to a chest in front of Mama’s desk and reaches in, and he withdraws an old Macintosh PowerBook. And he kind of sighs as he pulls it out, and tries to get it to boot up.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: What’s that, Barclay?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says, as he’s like, waiting for this thing to turn on, he says,

speaker: Barclay
lines: Okay, so—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Now, let me be clear, this isn’t one of those like, “Kids React” videos, like I know that’s a computer. [laughs] I assure—

speaker: Clint
lines: [exaggerated] What’s a computer?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Alright.

speaker: Justin
lines: [imitating this GI Joe parody] What’s a compoo-tuh?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says,

speaker: Barclay
lines: All right, so The Pine Guard was established after the abominations first started appearing in Kepler back in 1988, and some concerned citizens around town found out about the monsters, and about Sylvain, and they took it upon themselves to start fighting back in secret. And their ranks have fluctuated since those days. Folks… y’know, died, fighting the abominations, some packed up and left town.

speaker: Mama’s been with ’em from the start, but she was trying to fight ‘em alone for such a long time before she found me, a few years ago. This computer used to belong to a dude named Thacker. He was with The Pine Guard from the start, too. He kept notes on everything they ever fought, in this… [frustrated] the oldest functioning computer on this fucking planet.
Griffin
lines: And he like, kind of slaps his palm against it, waiting for it to start. And he says,

speaker: Barclay
lines: About six years ago, Thacker took off in the middle of the night without a word to anyone.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he kind of sighs, and he looks around the office, and he says

speaker: Barclay
lines: There’s a lot of that going around these days.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then the computer plays its startup noise, and a few moments later, Barclay says,

speaker: Barclay
lines: Okay, okay. Back in ’97, The Pine Guard went toe-to-toe with… well, they called it an Elemental. It lived in fire and smoke— it could control it, it could move through it, and it took them… Holy shit, it took ‘em burning a whole mine out just to take it down. It kind of sounds like what we’re dealing with today, right?

speaker: Ned
lines: Except it’s water, and not fire.

speaker: Barclay
lines: Sure, but the concept of, you know, light inside of elements controlling it and using it as form, and as a weapon… it sounds like kind of what we’re dealing with.

speaker: Ned
lines: Was there any mention of a bright yellow bug light involved?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He taps around, and he says,

speaker: Barclay
lines: Yeah… obviously it’s hard to see that in the fire, but they could see the light in smoke moving around.

speaker: Duck
lines: And it only controlled fire, is that correct?

speaker: Barclay
lines: Uh, yeah, that’s what it says.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: It didn’t move to like, “earth,” or “heart?”

speaker: Barclay
lines: [laughing] No, it didn’t move to “heart.” That would be a wild monster, though, somebody who could get inside of love.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: I just want to make sure we don’t have to fight— I don’t want to fight Captain Planet. And I just want to make sure…

speaker: Duck
lines: If we ever fight a monster that could control the power of heart, we’re all fucked, because that is the most powerful element imaginable.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Obviously. That was the only one that had an animal friend. Wait, did water—

speaker: Duck
lines: I mean, I’ll fucking stab love, I don’t care, I’ll try, I’m just saying I don’t think it’s going to be that effective.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah, that’s fair.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Barclay puts on some glasses— actually, some reading glasses that were already on Mama’s desk, and he says

speaker: Barclay
lines: So it says here that magic and magically imbued weapons could hurt it, but not kill it. To kill something intangible, you need… an intangible weapon? It doesn’t say what they ended up using, though.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Well, hold on. So if it moves through the element, could we starve it? If we could separate it from a source of water, and then chop away… we could severely weaken it, and at the very least, maybe shrink it to a manageable mass?

speaker: Duck
lines: I mean, it’s a really nice thought, but you’re dealing with— I mean, you’ve still got a question of humidity in the air, I don’t think that we would be able to remove water— moisture from the air, at its sort of molecular level. Right? There’s no reason to think it would need a full body of water if it could work with the humidity in the air.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Hmm.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Barclay says,

speaker: Barclay
lines: It’s an idea, though!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he opens up a new, like, document on this very, very old computer, which probably takes like, 45 seconds just to do, and he starts taking notes on the water elemental, and says

speaker: Barclay
lines: We could maybe use that for the hunt.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then he clicks back to the fire elemental, and he says,

speaker: Barclay
lines: Says here that it was a pretty tough target to take down. Not only did it possess incredible strength in the right environment, it also… “marked and pursued those it viewed as a threat to its existence.”

speaker: Ned
lines: Yeah…

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Shit!

speaker: Barclay
lines: Yeah. It says here… man, they lost someone on this hunt, a guy named Mike. It followed him into his car, got in the fuel line.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Not Mike!

speaker: Ned
lines: Aw, I love his hard lemonade!

speaker: Barclay
lines: [crosstalk] I don’t know if he was the lemonade—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [crosstalk] I enjoyed his run on Mystery Science Theater 3000.

speaker: Barclay
lines: [sighs] Anyone else have any famous Mikes that they wanna…? Duck, you got one?

speaker: Duck
lines: I mean, they did two, I figure…

speaker: Barclay
lines: Yeah, we’re probably okay.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah, who needs a third to be funny!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Barclay
lines: If y’all went toe-to-toe with this thing in the water, you’ve… we should probably keep in mind the possibility you’ve been marked too. You might want to stay out of bodies of water ’til we wrap this one up.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Should we send someone to check on swimmer dude?

speaker: Ned
lines: Yeah, what did he do that “harmed” the water?

speaker: Barclay
lines: I think it sounds like he was just there when this thing showed up.

speaker: Ned
lines: Or, he peed in it.

speaker: Barclay
lines: Another possibility.

speaker: Griffin
lines: There’s a flash that sways back and forth across the ceiling, a reflection of light against water from outside the window immediately behind Barclay. And he says

speaker: Barclay
lines: Okay, so no baths obviously, not in the hot springs or your tub, or whatever, if you had any plans on wading in the—

speaker: Duck
lines: Wait, what the hell was that?

speaker: Barclay
lines: What was what?

speaker: Duck
lines: Just now, right behind you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That light on the ceiling now, it’s swaying even faster now, like a bright light reflecting against the surface of water, shining in from the outside.

speaker: Duck
lines: Hold on, just— hold on a second, Barclay, we gotta figure this out.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [nervously] You might want to step, like, over here, Barclay maybe, away from the window a little bit?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He stands up and faces the window, and through it, you can see down to the tall wooden fence surrounding the hot springs behind the lodge. And while normally this angle wouldn’t allow you to see the waters, you can see them quite clearly now they are floating in a perfect 8-foot-wide sphere, hovering above the fence’s perimeter. And trapped inside, thrashing ineffectively… is Jake Coolice.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: No!

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, when I said “We gotta figure this out,” that was me leading into attempting to Read A Bad Situation, [crosstalk] so I would like to do that now.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Okay! Yeah, please.

speaker: Justin
lines: And I got a seven, plus one… Eight.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. You…

speaker: Justin
lines: Let’s see… that gives me one question. Um… “What’s the best way to protect the victims?”

speaker: Griffin
lines: You need to get Jake Coolice out of this floating sphere of water. You can tell that the fact that he’s thrashing and stuff means that he’s not like, unconscious or dead, but you do not know how long he has been in that water, and you assume that he will be one of those two things if you do not get the fuck down there and get him out.

speaker: Travis
lines: Let’s do that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: One thing that we need to keep in mind with Read A Bad Situation is while acting on the answers, you get plus one ongoing while the information is relevant. So if you do anything to get Jake Coolice out of the water, Duck, now you have a plus one to do so.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay. Just so I— I’m trying to clarify the situation for myself. It’s outside, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Out like, above the Jacuzzi, and we’re inside, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: [amused] It is not a Jacuzzi, it is like, a hot spring. [Clint laughs] This is not like, a Motel 6.

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s God’s Jacuzzi, Griffin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s God’s, it’s the Mountain’s Jacuzzi, yes.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, I’m going to run outside.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Aubrey and Ned?

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Is Jake Coolice, um…

speaker: Clint
lines: Important?

speaker: Justin
lines: From Sylvain?

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh.

speaker: Justin
lines: Sorry! [laughing] Is he essential personnel? No—

speaker: Travis
lines: ’Cause we were kind of getting into a groove, just discussing what was going on, and I’d hate to lose that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yes, Jake Coolice is from Sylvain. The three of you, and Barclay, go running out of the office towards the door that leads out to the hot springs behind the building. I think Agent Stern actually like, pokes his head out his bedroom door as he sees you all running, and he’s like,

speaker: Agent Stern
lines: Is everything okay…?

speaker: Ned
lines: Coyotes! Coyotes.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [crosstalk] Yo!

speaker: Duck
lines: [crosstalk] Yeah, coyote. Got coyotes. Let’s stay in your room, stay in your room, partner, we got a coyote situation.

speaker: Ned
lines: [crosstalk] Yes, please stay in your room.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: But it’s a protected— it’s a protected coyote that we have to just kind of herd.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Barclay’s just like, gone, while you all are… he does not want his precious boy Jake Coolice to die.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Okay, sleep good, bye!

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m saying this is as we’re, like, running past him, like—

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, like. [imitates voice trailing off into distance] “Coyotes…!”

speaker: Duck
lines: It’s a forestry situation, I’ll take care of it, don’t worry, everything’s fine, partner. Just stay in your room, because they can get a little vicious.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He nods and shuts the door, and the three of you follow Barclay down into the— through the door that sort of branches off the lobby down to the hot springs. You pass by a dressing room as you run down a set of wooden stairs and exit out into the hot springs. It has sort of a stone perimeter around the actual— well, where the water used to be, with like, a wooden base actually inside of the pool. And it’s surrounded by this tall fence, which is kind of lined with stacks of towels, and some buckets, and you are now face-to-face with the water sphere that Jake Coolice is trapped inside.

speaker: Clint
lines: I need to investigate— I want to know something really important that maybe we can see by just observing, but is the water— is the sphere of water just free-floating, or is it connected?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It is free-floating, off the ground.

speaker: Clint
lines: It hasn’t done that before! It had— I mean, before, at the pool, it was connected to the water, whatever shapes it made— this is not connected in any way.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, do we see the sphere of light in the sphere?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think, yeah— I think this— that’s a good point, I think this water is disconnected enough, and not, y’know, deep enough, that you do see this light, and it is almost like, swirling around Jake Coolice’s form in the water.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Barclay, what— what is Jake?

speaker: Barclay
lines: [panicked] Does— Does it matter?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He’s like, looking around.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: It might!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He picks up a bucket and like, throws it at the water, and it just like, gets sucked up into the form, and he like shrugs, like, “I don’t know, I threw a bucket, what do you do?”

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Here’s the thing I could maybe try to like, blast him out of the water? But I’m not going to be able to do that without hurting him, I don’t think.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Jake is now clutching at his throat.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [crosstalk] Ah shit!

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] Okay, that’s it! I’m going to— I pull out Beacon.

speaker: Beacon
lines: [drawls] Yes, Duck Newton. This is… well, I don’t really know what we’re supposed to do with this one, eh, Duck? It’s a… quite a challenge.

speaker: Duck
lines: Okay, Beacon. All right. Thank you for your input, that’s great.

speaker: Justin
lines: And I extend him from his coiled position, and I tell Beacon

speaker: Duck
lines: Hey, hold on tight, partner.

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughs] And I chuck him at the yellow light.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh… Okay. I think this is going to be a Kick Some Ass roll.

speaker: Justin
lines: My main goal is to protect someone. I’m trying to distract, basically. I don’t intend on like, trying to damage the thing.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Hm, okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: But I’m trying to protect Jake Coolice with this move. So like, even if it’s not a direct hit or whatever, I’m trying to draw the heat, basically.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, how about this, then it would be a Protect Someone roll, right?

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] Right, that’s what I was thinking.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Since you are not intending to actually hurt it. So go ahead and roll plus Tough.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, that is seven, plus… two. So nine on that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay—

speaker: Justin
lines: Plus one, because I am acting…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Acting Under Pressure! Good.

speaker: Justin
lines: Acting Under Pressure, yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, so. You protect them okay—

speaker: Justin
lines: No, not Acting Under Pressure, acting on my Read A Bad Situation roll.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Right, right, right. So, on your Protect Someone, on a 10-plus, you protect them okay, but you suffer some or all of the harm you were going to get. So on a 10-plus, you get to choose an extra effect you either suffer a little harm, minus one harm; all impending danger is now focused on you; you inflict harm on the enemy; or you hold the enemy back.

speaker: Justin
lines: On your read of it, would “you hold the enemy back” pull him off of Jake, like in this particular situation?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, I think— I think here’s how we could— ’cause I don’t know how to do it like, you free him by just like, hitting him with a sword and you knock Jake Coolice out of the water as you launch a sword in his direction. Here’s what I think happens I think the water fluctuates as this magically-imbued sword, like, jabs into it, and you get this thing pretty close to the yellow light, close enough that you don’t actually hit Jake Coolice with your very good roll. And I think, as a result, Jake Coolice kind of like, unnaturally just like, falls out of the water, and lands on the wooden floor of the hot spring. And the water, like, shifts in the air, and it moves around you and then closes and sucks you into the center of it now, and now you are floating inside of this 8-foot sphere. [crosstalk] And Jake Coolice—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] So Duck is extra tough, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, so he has armor, and what you have to keep in mind about armor in this game is it works in fiction like everything else. So like, if he gets pounded by a big bear, his armor is going to help him out there. If he starts drowning, or is crushed by, y’know, a supernatural weight of water, or is burned by a magic fire spell, or something like that…

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh-huh, uh-huh. [laughs] Go on.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Armor won’t help him.

speaker: Travis
lines: Ohh.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, Ned, while Duck was doing that, Ned has been knotting towels together, and he has tied one end of it to one of the deck chairs sitting around the hot spring area.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughs] Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m going to take one of these chairs with the towels tied to it, and throw the chair as hard as I can towards Duck.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, yeah, I don’t even think you need to roll for that, and I think because you saw Barclay throw a bucket into the water, and saw it just got absorbed, that you know that that is exactly what happens here. And that is what happens; the deck chair goes into the water, and gets sucked into its form, and is now floating next to Duck. Now, if you want to try to use this to retrieve Duck from the water, I think you’ll have to roll Act Under Pressure or something like that.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yep, that’s what I’m going to do.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, why don’t you go ahead and roll Act Under Pressure, then.

speaker: Clint
lines: Uh, seven plus one, for cool, so that’s an eight.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, as you do this, the deck chair goes into the water and you see Duck kind of recognize what you’re doing. As you are trying to achieve this, and you are, you know, gripping on tight to the towels, you see a few almost like, wire-like tendrils, these like, gnarly-looking tendrils, like six of them, reach out of the water in your direction, and if you, y’know, hold put and try to pull Duck out of the water, these things are going to whip at you. Do you move, and compromise your rescue mission, or do you take the hit?

speaker: Clint
lines: Ooh. Uh, well that… That changes things. Um… [Griffin laughs] Yeah, I’m not sure Ned is as dedicated to, uh… to old Duck as he is to, you know, not getting pierced by water-needles. So…

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s the thing, man, reflexes! Reflexes are hard to shake!

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughing] Yeah, in the moment, you want to do the right thing, but in the heat— to save your old buddy Duck— the heat of the moment…

speaker: Ned
lines: Yeah… You’re a good man, Duck, I know you can figure this out!

speaker: Clint
lines: And then Ned gets out of the way.

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right, I like that. I think your fight-or-flight response kicks in and you roll out of the way as these six tendrils like, stab— you described them as “water needles” and I like that, they just like, stab in your direction, and you roll out of the way and avoid the damage, but as you do, you let go of the towel-chain that you built, and now, Duck, you were holding onto this patio chair inside of the water, and the towels connected to it are just kind of like, hanging down from the sphere, and Ned, you are safe from this danger. [crosstalk] Aubrey, what do you do?

speaker: Ned
lines: [crosstalk] Whoo! Close call. [laughs nervously]

speaker: Travis
lines: Aubrey is going to hope, and pray, that Duck’s toughness wins out as she blasts the sphere with some fire.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Interesting, okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, so I’m trying to be really controlled. I looked this up— water turns to steam at 212 degrees, and so I’m hoping, since it was a hot springs to begin with, it’s not going to take much. So I’m not like, aiming at Duck.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I get what you’re doing. So go ahead and— this would be a Kick Some Ass roll.

speaker: Travis
lines: So I rolled a 10, minus one for Tough— Aubrey, the physical is—

speaker: Griffin
lines: No no no, you roll with Weird for your Kick Some Ass-es.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh! Then it’s an 11— then it’s a 12, it’s a 10 plus two then, for Weird, for magic.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay! On that, you and the water deal damage to each other, but with its—

speaker: Travis
lines: On a 12!? Oh.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, on any Kick Some Ass, you and your enemy deal damage to one another. On a 10-plus, though, you pick an extra effect you gain the advantage, take plus one forward; give plus one forward to another hunter; you inflict terrible harm, plus one harm; you suffer less harm, minus one harm; or you force them where you want them.

speaker: Travis
lines: I would like— can I force them where I want them and push them off—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, I don’t think that’s how that would work, right? I get that—

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, then I want to grant one forward to Duck.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, I like that.

speaker: Travis
lines: So like, use it to create an opportunity for Duck.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sure, for him to escape. Right, okay. So you blast this thing, and— how much harm does your fire spell do?

speaker: Travis
lines: Two harm, plus two harm fire. And if you get a 10+ on a combat magic roll, the fire won’t spread. So, four harm.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s fine, I don’t know how it would have spread, you’re… you’re blasting water. It’s like, essentially, it is dousing your flames as you put them out— as you launch them. You actually get the feeling that you are not doing as much damage to this water with your fire magic than you should be. You are creating a significant amount of steam, which looks fucking rad, like it— it hits the surface of this water sphere, and you know, as the fire contacts it, like, there’s a ripple that travels through the sphere. But it does not seem super effective to combat this thing with fire in the way that you are used to. And I think those needles that were going after Ned like, whip around, and instead of piercing you, they just whip towards you and lash across you, and you take two harm.

speaker: Travis
lines: [sucks air through teeth] All right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Duck, you are up. Now, this thing, because it like, turned its attention to Aubrey, some of the water— it’s not like a perfect sphere any more, it’s a bit misshapen, and you get the impression that, if you did want to escape, you would have an opening to do so, [crosstalk] if you can figure out a way to.

lines: [crosstalk] Did I steam some off, too? Like, did the surface…?

lines: Yeah, I think you definitely steamed some of it off. It’s hard to tell, right, you can’t like, identify how much volume of water is floating in the air—

lines: No wrinkles. Perfect, perfectly pressed.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You stab this thing forward into the light, and as you do so, the light like— you’re right up against it, so you can see it pretty clearly. It like, spasms, in a strange way— I think actually the whole— oh, this is great. Ned and Aubrey, you actually see all the water kind of like, spasm outward, and the sphere actually goes up in the air another few feet, and it forms this weird, abstract shape in the air, almost like this thing is, like, losing control a little bit. And then it all in the blink of an eye, like, sucks back in. And Duck, as it sort of reforms, the pressure inside this water gets like, so intense, it is crushing you like you are, y’know, very very deep in the ocean without a suit. And it actually also gets kind of hot, and you take two harm, ignoring armor as it kind of like, crushes you. But after it does so, Ned and Aubrey, you see the sphere of water now just sort of succumb to gravity, and fall and splash back down into the pool. And it obviously splashes up quite a ways as it does so, and Duck, you see the light quickly zip away and into a vent in the pool, and disappear.

lines: Perfect!

lines: [drawls] It is a shame, though. While floating in the water, I was so assured of Duck Newton’s destruction, I had begun fantasizing about my next owner. Would they be exciting, willing to take adventures? [Clint laughs] So many possibilities awaited me while I had a pleasant daydream in the water. But I was very… [drawn out] happy to see you survive, Duck Newton.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The four of you are walking through the forest, toward the gate, and it is indeed lovely tonight; the sky is clear, allowing the moon to pierce the canopy of the pine trees overhead, illuminating your passage through the woods with ease. The remnants of the summer cicadas are singing a quiet song from deeper in the forest, backed by the sound of the fallen pine needles that crunch beneath your feet with each step. And Moira explains,

speaker: Moira
lines: So, the Enchanter is a mysterious being. It has taken many shapes and names for as long as I’ve known it. It resides in the catacombs beneath the city, where it does its work, tinkering with imbuing the light of Sylvain into various trinkets and odds and ends that it collects. If you want it to cooperate, though, you’re going to have to deliver it an item of value from this world. Collecting Earth artifacts is one of its favorite pastimes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She reaches into a handbag she’s carrying. She is in her human form, she reaches into a handbag she’s carrying and she retrieves a set of pearl earrings, which she hands to Ned. And she says,

speaker: Moira
lines: I think these should suffice for what you all require. It is a crafty one, The Enchanter, but it remains straightforward in its business dealings.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Moira
lines: I would take you directly to it if I could, but… once exiled from Sylvain, we are never allowed to return. Just find your way into the catacombs and follow the sound of the wind, you’ll get there.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Do you eat?

speaker: Moira
lines: Um, I do not require physical sustenance, just a dip in the hot springs every now and then to sort of refill my… I don’t know, “life force” or whatever you want to call it? We used to—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Mmhm, mmhm. But could you eat? And if you did, would it fall straight through?

speaker: Moira
lines: It would be weird, I honestly haven’t tried since I took on this spectral form, but you seem intent to do some sort of—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Were you born a ghost?

speaker: Moira
lines: No… When a citizen of Sylvain perishes in the presence of Sylvain’s light, they don’t die, in the traditional sense. They’re given a reprieve, in these ghostly forms, until they’ve decided that they’ve found the peace that they require before passing on for good. That’s actually what makes living on this side such a distasteful prospect for those living in Sylvain— if we die over here, we are not granted that reprieve.

speaker: Ned
lines: And what kind of being were you before?

speaker: Moira
lines: I was a Sylph! Much like Dani, I suppose. I know of your knowledge of our—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: A vampire.

speaker: Moira
lines: If that’s the way that you want to classify it, sure, a vampire.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [awed] Okay.

speaker: Ned
lines: But we don’t deal with labels, so much.

speaker: Moira
lines: I would prefer not to.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The four of you arrive at the clearing, and you find a familiar scene. Amidst a blanket of pine needles stands the archway, lit from above by the dazzling moonlight overhead. And Moira reaches into her handbag, and retrieves a small compact mirror, which she catches the moonlight in and directs it towards the gate. And as she does so, the span of the archway is filled with white light, and she says,

speaker: Moira
lines: A moment, if you will, Aubrey.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah?

speaker: Moira
lines: I know you’re searching for answers about the origins of the magic that dwells within you. If you have the time, you may find it prudent to inquire about your abilities while in Sylvain. It is a land rife with arcane energies; it is likely that someone over there might have some answers to your questions.

speaker: Ned
lines: Point of order, Duck Didn’t the goat-head fellow tell you that you could never set foot in Sylvain again?

speaker: Duck
lines: Ah shit, that’s true. Moira, why do you think that would’ve been?

speaker: Moira
lines: Ah, obviously, we— I shouldn’t say “we” anymore… The citizens of Sylvain have many reasons not to trust humankind. But if you all are members of The Pine Guard, the arrangement, I believe you’ll find, has changed significantly. You all should be free to walk around there, as long as you have your patches. You all have your patches, right?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yep!

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Ned
lines: [hesitantly] Yes.

speaker: Moira
lines: Ned, you sounded like you maybe don’t have your patch?

speaker: Ned
lines: Well, I was wondering if I had had time to get my tattoo yet, but no… No, I’ve got my patch.

speaker: Moira
lines: A tattoo is a novel idea, but the patch itself is crafted from Sylvan wool. There’s a curse bestowed upon Earthlings who enter our world, and having a garment crafted from any sort of Sylman— Sylvan fabric will protect you from it, so it’s important you keep the patch on you as well.

speaker: Ned
lines: I do, I’ve got in on a s— a scarf.

speaker: Travis
lines: Aubrey is just like bouncing to go through the big, glowing doorway.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sure.

speaker: Duck
lines: Hey, listen, just a warning y’all. Um… It’s weird over there. [stammers] You know—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Okay bye!

speaker: Travis
lines: [giggling] She runs through.

speaker: Clint
lines: Aubrey rushes in.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughs] Yeah. Yeah, I follow behind.

speaker: Ned
lines: Oh, shit. [resigned] Alright.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The three of you step through the gate. Ned, you last, and I think you see Moira giving you like, a kind of condescending thumbs up, and that’s the last thing you see as you step through. And for a moment, the three of you are all weightless in this bright, white expanse. You feel wind whipping through you, almost as if you’re falling through a long tunnel, and these rings of light are pulsating around you as you fly. And then the three of you step out of an identical gate and into another world into Sylvain.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re standing in a large, circular pavilion, surrounded by large stones columns holding up a solid stone roof 20 feet overhead, and through the columns directly in front of you, you can see the city. And, as you might expect, you’ve never really seen anything quite like it before.

speaker: There’s a long, dust-covered road that extends outward from this pavilion and serves as a main drag through the town, and it’s lined with shops and restaurants, with outdoor seating, all occupied by diners of shapes and sizes that you can’t quite discern from a distance. And off the road, to the east, the town scales up the side of a steep hill, where these small, colorful cottages are piled on top of one another, leading up to the peak, where a quaint-looking park sits. To the west, a series of several large buildings are arranged.

Just off the main drag, you see what looks like a school, a large library, what appears to be this world’s version of a hospital, more functional buildings, as opposed to the residential district built onto the side of the hill. And though you find something kind of relatable about the layout of the city, there’s something decidedly alien about the architecture. To put it succinctly, where most of our world’s architecture is based around like, clean angles, and rectangular geometry, buildings in Sylvain are more round. Not Seussian, but like… with far more curves, and far less uniformity than any city you’ve ever seen before.

And so the main drag, it cuts across a bridge spanning a small river that cuts the town in half, and beyond it, you see something more surprising still— a castle of gray cobblestone. It’s the largest building in sight, with these huge gardens that extend from its walls, reaching nearly all the way down to the river. And immediately in front of this castle is a large courtyard, which hosts the most eye-catching feature of the entire city
lines: a crystal [Travis gasps softly] jutting up through the ground, standing 15 feet high. There’s a bright orange light pulsating from within this shape. It is an impressive thing, even though the side of it appears to have a large chunk missing, almost as if it’s been cleaved off completely.

speaker: And as you all enter through the gate, two guards approach you from the columns in front of you, and they’re both holding spears. One of them has sharp fangs that they’re baring, and bright orange eyes, not unlike the features you’ve seen on Dani in her undisguised form. And the other guard simply has a squirrel head for a head.

lines: And it is Vincent, the goat man.

speaker: Duck
lines: [sighs] Hey, Vince. Yeah, I was trying to be… [sighs] We’re in the Pine Guard? I kind of thought that would be all that y’all would need to hear, that’s what Moira said. But you know what, I did— I maybe should’ve put her through due diligence now that I think about it, I did just kind of accept that as gospel, but— we’re looking for an Enchanter, ’cause we got a lot of your people over on the other side that are gonna be in a pretty bad way if we don’t get our hot spring fixed up. There’s some sort of elemental creature, of some sort, that’s making it pretty inhospitable at the moment.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He listens to you. As soon as you said you were in the Pine Guard, you see a big smile across his face, and he says

speaker: Vincent
lines: Yes, I figured it was only a matter of time. We only met for a brief while, but I figured that this was probably in the cards. I apologize for the inconvenience, but could you provide some proof of your testimony?

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah, I mean I got… I got it right here.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’ve still got the patch in my hand, so I show it to him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He nods, and he says,

speaker: Vincent
lines: So you’ve come to see the Enchanter. I assume you need some help hunting down one of the abominations?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: We’ve found it a couple times now, and I think it’s going to come for us. We more need help in the killing part of it.

speaker: Vincent
lines: And— sorry, what was your friends’ names, Duck?

speaker: Duck
lines: Uh, this is Aubrey and Ned.

speaker: Ned
lines: Yo!

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Hi!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He smiles and he says,

speaker: Vincent
lines: My name is Vincent. I am the Minister of Defense here in Sylvain. I understand you need to see the Enchanter. I can take you to him—

speaker: Duck
lines: Cool, all right, let’s go.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Um…

speaker: Vincent
lines: I must insist I accompany you as long as you are in our world, and I must also insist that you make your introductions to the Interpreter, as is custom for those who serve to protect Sylvain from the world beyond.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: The Interpret—

speaker: Ned
lines: And who is that?

speaker: Vincent
lines: My, you seem to not know much about our world at all. I suppose that makes sense.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: It’s our first day here!

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah. Like, let me ask you about the… fucking cast of Friends, like what—

speaker: Vincent
lines: You’re talking about Matt LeBlanc, and Matthew Perry, and—

speaker: Duck
lines: [crosstalk] Ah, fuck. God, son of a— he’s good.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [crosstalk] Damn!

speaker: Duck
lines: He’s real good.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Vincent
lines: The Interpreter does just that, interprets the will of Sylvain, which helps to form the laws that govern our world. I suppose you could think of them as a kind of ruler, here— unelected, obviously, and with checks and balances represented by their ministers. It is custom for those who serve in the Pine Guard to at least make introductions to the Interpreter. But that can wait, she is resting now as is. We can go see the Enchanter, and then just swing by for a quick pit stop later.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Um, quick question, and forgive me, ’cause I’ll probably end up just like, asking everybody we run into— Do you have like, magic tutors, or a book I could read about— Let me start here I do magic. Um, both stage and real.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He looks surprised when you say that.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Watch!

speaker: Travis
lines: Snaps fingers, thumb lights on fire. Boom, there.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: See?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He gets very close as you do this, and you see like, the light of the fire like, flashing across his face, and his eyes get wide [crosstalk] as he sees that—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] In his weird, goat eyes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: His eyes— his goat eyes are beautiful. He says,

speaker: Vincent
lines: This is no parlor trick, correct? This is real magic?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: No, do you want to see that though?

speaker: Travis
lines: And then, like… card trick.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, you do a quick card trick. He says—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: I can do both!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says,

speaker: Vincent
lines: I… this is quite curious. I suppose I can introduce you to the Minister of the Arcane, in our world, they might be able to help you out with—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Hell yeah!

speaker: Vincent
lines: Aubrey—

speaker: Duck
lines: Is it… Is it Cornelius Fudge? [snickers]

speaker: Vincent
lines: From the Harry Potter books?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: God!

speaker: Duck
lines: Damn, you’re good, man!

speaker: Ned
lines: Jiminy Christmas!

speaker: Duck
lines: I cannot get one past you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He smiles, and he says,

speaker: Vincent
lines: Aubrey, I must ask… you are not Sylvan, are you?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Hoo-man as they come.

speaker: Vincent
lines: I see.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: I think?

speaker: Vincent
lines: That is quite curious. I think it would serve all of us very well to know where your powers come from. I will make an introduction to the Minister of the Arcane when we stop by the castle. But for now, let’s carry out your errand.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he nods, and the other two guards like, lower their spears, and step back.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Question, do we need to pretend to not be here? Is it going to be weird that we’re here? [drops voice] Are people going to look at us weird?

speaker: Vincent
lines: Oh, people are definitely going to look at you weird, but there is an arrangement that has existed between our people and the Pine Guard for some time now, so you will find some amount of understanding from the citizens here.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Vincent starts walking you down that main drag, toward the hill, the residential district on the east side of town. And you pass by several blocks of these colorful, round buildings, and as you do, you get a clearer picture of the folks who reside here. A lot of them are like Dani and the guard by the entrance, similar to what our world would consider vampires, with these fangs and bright eyes — some of them have that kind of ghostly form that Moira showed you all, but they seem to just be like, conducting their business in the same way as everybody else here. You see a ghost float out of a bakery, carrying a box of freshly-made pastries—

speaker: Travis
lines: [singing Belle from Disney’s Beauty and the Beast] “There goes the baker with his tray, like always…”

speaker: Griffin
lines: And this ghost is chatting happily with the shop’s corporeal owner. But you also see a lot of beings with various Earth animal characteristics. You see people with the fur and fangs of wolves, you see more squirrel-like people, you see some bipedal bird people. There’s a lizard person busking on the streets, playing a beautiful song on a harp.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Vincent, can I ask you a quick question?

speaker: Vincent
lines: Yes, go ahead.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: How long have people been crossing over to our world? Because this would explain a lot of stories and folktales, and stuff.

speaker: Vincent
lines: I would not venture to say that we are responsible for all of your world’s lore, that would be— that would be irresponsible of me. But, you could probably trace some of the stories of your world to Sylvans who crossed over and, for whatever reason, made themselves known to the human population. Our worlds have been connected for centuries and centuries, so I would imagine that perhaps some of the stories of your world could be attributed to our people crossing over. But your people have been crossing over into our world for centuries too, and not just humans— animals, too, have wandered through the gates. That’s where I come from; as time passed, the light of Sylvain gave the animals who wandered into our world new forms and gave us a place in our society, which was a rocky transition at first, but now we’re just as much valued citizens of this place as those who originated here.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And as he says that, he like, nods to just a… a dog person. A person with the head of—

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m a dog person!

speaker: Griffin
lines: This is a literal, literal dog person. And finally you reach the foot of the residential district, where Vincent directs you towards a large stone circular door built into the hill which he slides open, and then lights a torch mounted by the door, and leads you down several flights of stairs into the catacombs under the city. And you walk for several minutes through stone-carved tunnels, and the sound of the street and music from the city above fade behind you, until you can only hear wind that is growing louder as you navigate the twists and turns of the catacombs. And finally, you turn a corner, and you see no tunnels in front of you at all; just a platform overlooking a large chasm that swallows the light of Vincent’s torch, expanding into what seems like infinite darkness. And he motions you forward, and he says,

speaker: Vincent
lines: Watch your step.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he kind of smiles.

speaker: Ned
lines: Hmm. [crosstalk] Is there… is there a safety rail or…?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [crosstalk] Okay!

speaker: Vincent
lines: No… I can talk to public works to try to get one installed, I suppose, if that’s a concern of yours?

speaker: Ned
lines: No, no, I worry about my... friends. You know, falling off the edge.

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah, I already got two points of armor, man, I’m fine.

speaker: Ned
lines: Oof… okay. Um… Uh, yeah, let’s step… very, very, very carefully onto the platform, as close to jumping back as I can.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [pretending to lose balance] Woah, wooahh! Ned, woahh!

speaker: Ned
lines: [crosstalk] [wailing] Vertigo! Ohh god!

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [crosstalk] Woah, Ned! It’s so—

speaker: Travis
lines: And Aubrey’s just fucking with Ned. [laughs]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, sure.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Woah, pretty far down, huh, Ned? Woah…! Ned, come look, come look!

speaker: Ned
lines: [whimpers] No, I’m good right here. This way I can keep an eye on the—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Ohh, it’s so far… Oh, whoo!

speaker: Ned
lines: I want to keep an eye out with my peripheral vision, just, you know… in case of danger.

speaker: Griffin
lines: As you all step out onto this platform overlooking the chasm, it is silent for a moment, and then… I think your footsteps like, kick off some dust that you hear fall down the chasm. And then you hear really loud breathing coming from below. Loud, rhythmic breathing, almost like the purring of like, a gigantic cat.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you hear a voice say,

speaker: Voice
lines: [drawn-out, enunciated] What business do you have with me, Earthlings?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And this voice just echoes through the whole chamber.

speaker: Duck
lines: We require a, uh, a weapon that can defeat… I guess a sort of elemental?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Like water?

speaker: Duck
lines: Like a weapon that can kill water? That sounds stupid when I say it.

speaker: Ned
lines: Really super-absorbent towels, maybe? More absorbent towels?

speaker: Duck
lines: Like magically absorbent, yeah.

speaker: Ned
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Like a Sham… Like a ShamWow?

speaker: Duck
lines: Like a ShamWow…

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [crosstalk] Yeah.

speaker: Ned
lines: [crosstalk] Oh, yeah. Mmhm.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The wind picks up from below you as you speak, almost knocking you off your feet, which is probably pretty scary, given your position, as a massive shape lifts up from the darkness below you. And suddenly, the light from Vincent’s torch illuminates two great yellow eyes with narrow slits for pupils, [Clint chuckles] which eye you over quickly before the figure fully emerges. It is a cat. An unthinkably gigantic gray anthropomorphic cat, and it says

speaker: Cat
lines: Well, that sounds like quite a challenge! I suppose introductions are in order. The people of this world know me as the Enchanter, master artisan of the arcane— you may call me by my name.

speaker: [Justin, Clint, and Travis burst into laughter]
